locale.message: This plugin allows third-party authentication via a LDAP service.
With this plugin enabled, a LDAP service can be used to authenticate users.
Please enter the LDAP Url which may have ldaps:// and :636.
Please enter the LDAP suffix where LAM should start to search for users.
Please enter the LDAP filter that will be used to choose which accounts to use to login. You may use %USER% as the user who is loggin in.
Here you can specify the DN of the bind user that will be used for the LDAP search. This is required if your LDAP server does not allow anonymous access.
Here you can specify the password of the bind user that will be used for the LDAP search. This is required if your LDAP server does not allow anonymous access.
Where LDAP users can activate and change their password.
